intro: Melica minuta subsp. major, commonly known as slender meadowgrass, is a perennial grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows, stream banks, and woodlands. The plant has slender,丛生 stems that can reach heights of up to 60 cm, with narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a spike-like arrangement of small, two-lobed spikelets. The species is characterized by its delicate appearance and is often found in disturbed or nutrient-rich soils.
